triples.evidence: In this molecule, the gadolinium ion - which has seven unpaired electrons - is enclosed within a stable chelating cage.

triples.o: brighter signal on the MRI image
triples.evidence: When water molecules come close to the contrast agent, they experience local magnetic field changes that speed up their T₁ relaxation, producing a brighter signal on the MRI image.
Notice the bright region within the brain - this enhancement clearly reveals a tumor.
